description.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to decrease open defecation, improve and sustain water, sanitation and hygiene services and systems in times of stability and crisis through strengthened enabling environments enhanced accountability and the establishment of new social norms and robust WASH behaviours.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 5815 Lekhnath Marg Kathmandu Nepal

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to decrease open defecation, improve and sustain water, sanitation and hygiene services and systems in times of stability and crisis; through strengthened enabling environments; enhanced accountability and the establishment of new social norms and robust WASH behaviours.

description.narrative: The regional headline result was exceeded in 2019 with 164 million fewer people defecating in the open in South Asia and all complimentary results also on-track. Innovative and blended financing opportunities were expanded, B4R work introduced in three countries and our work on climate change and the environment was strengthened. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019

title.narrative: Regional public/ private partnership for WASH established to support at scale
# of lessons learnt and good practices documented with support from ROSA to inform and enhance WASH programmes, based on COs KM plans
# of countries with budgeted SDG plans for WASH supported by ROSA
meetings supported and informed by ROSA to generated evidence and knowledge on new and emerging WASH issues

# of countries with completed SWA profiles and "leaving no one behind" budgeted plans
